title: Help me i need help before new year/chrismas!!
body:
Well hello boards  hope you will help me this time :D. 
Well 3 months im having issues with my fps in League of Legends i cant get over that anymore ! First i crashed my pc somehow.Then guy who made this pc said that better give me downgrade to windows 7 pro 32 bit (btw first was w10 home)then all started lags fps drops big fps drops then i started to begin crazy.I upgraded to windows 10 pro then and my computer is going a bit faster but fps is teribble....1Year im playing normally and then i crashed my pc and this happend.... here are my specs..could you say me what to do? 
Buy new processor or graphic card ik they are old components but i cant afford to much! 
SPECS 
Windows 10 Pro 
Processor : Intel (R) Pentium (R) Dual CPU E2160 1.80GHZ 
Installed memory (RAM) : 2GB 
System type: 64BIT OPERATING SYSTEM((((((BTW I TRIED W7 32 AND IT WAS LAME SO I ALMOST BACK UP MY PC I MEAN I GET W10 BUT PRO AND I WAS HAVING 64BIT))))

HOPE YOU WILL HELP ME I NEED HELP FAST IT WILL BE NEW YEAR SO MAYB I WILL GOT GRAPHIC OR PROCESSOR I DECIDE BUT IM REALLY YOUNG 13 YEARS OLD :D HELP!

replies.body: The [**Minimum Specs FAQ**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654) mentions needing at the very least a 2GHz processor, so that might be the main issue itself. Other than that, a bit more RAM could help, but I'd also check out the steps listed in our [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) to see if any of those troubleshooting steps can help at all.

You might want to increase your RAM to start with, especially if you have multiple processes open simultaneously. Otherwise, close off anything that you're not using and isn't necessary while you're playing.
I did it i disabled start up and close everything guy who made my pc said that ram wont help..

Honestly, even though I can't tell what graphics card you have, it sounds like he built you a cheap computer in the $100-200 range. If he thinks more ram won't help you out even a little bit, he doesn't really know anything. Windows 10 especially is quite heavy on older/cheaper computers. 4 GB of RAM is basically the low end, common amount for cheaper computers to even be able to run smoothly. If possible, getting 8 GB would be even better. Your processor is cheap, and that makes me think your graphics card is also cheap, so really, it depends on your budget/price range that you're able to look at. If possible, I'd upgrade both equally.
I will upgrade processor then and ram ? Thx
